This is probably off-topic.  Your questions regarding Borland products 
are better answered in the according newsgroup that can be found at 
http://info.borland.com/newsgroups/

You need to set the fixture to "RECORD" for the first time for the 
recorder to save the output.  After that, you can change the code to use 
COMPARE.  Please refer to the tutorial on Comparison Fixture that comes 
with JBuilder

Thanks
Shane

aem@... wrote:

>Hi,
>I'm doing some tests using comparisonFixture, bat I don't understand at
>all how it works. What I want to do is to save some data in a file and then
>later compare it with other results.
>
>I set the comparisonFixture to COMPARE  but then the test gives an error
>at the method comparisonFixture.recordObject(Object o)like this:
>
>java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: e
>	at com.borland.jbuilder.unittest.TestRecorder.a(Unknown Source)
>	at com.borland.jbuilder.unittest.TestRecorder.recordObject(Unknown Source)
>	at com.borland.jbuilder.unittest.TestRecorder.compareObject(Unknown Source)
>
>OK, I guess to use that method the mode has to be RECORD. The new data will be
>then saved in the file and then I'll loose the previous one, which one I wanted
>to compare it!!! 
>
>Is there a way to record some data, and later compare the new results whith it??
>
>Please if you have some experience with ComparisionFixture, and understand what
>Im trying to explain, give some ideas!!!
>
>Thanks !!
>
